lexUnit.name: flimsy.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: without material strength or solidity

sentence.text: We would be wise not to build too high a building on such a flimsy foundation .
It was n't as if he could see her in the flimsy satin nightdress , was it ?
He took the flimsy tin aeroplane in his hand and broke the wings off it .
Flimsy steel gates hung from two pillars .
Her grip tightened on the flimsy sheet .
Lily , like a classical nymph on a vase , spread her flimsy night-gown and danced in the sunlight .
With a single twist of his hand , he was able to snap the flimsy butterfly screw holding it in place .
Isabel stared back , trying not to let her flimsy hope show in her eyes as Matilda 's appraising look swept down to her feet and back again .
His own , slightly flimsy explanation is , ` It was the only job I could have done with my vague , easily bored , butterfly mind . "
As Hugo entered the office he whirled round , blundering into his flimsy chair and almost overturning it .
WOMEN 's tennis in this country is apt to be seen as a jokey disaster area , lost cause and eternal outlet for false and flimsy dreams .
In others , like the Baltic republics , democratic traditions had flimsy historical foundations .
Lucien enjoyed spending time in his company , but anticipated the day when this flimsy alliance would end .
She dropped the flimsy pages on to the table-top , concentrated on whisking two egg yolks in a china bowl .
The effectiveness of even the best quality locks will be reduced if a door frame is flimsy .
Alas , many others had already made their judgment on the flimsy evidence of that supposed phone call â€¦ and had found the next King guilty .
Pods , by design , are fairly flimsy .
A freak wave overturned the flimsy vessels and they were left floating in the water in their lifejackets .
On some , the roofs were so flimsy they could pull them off with rakes alone .
It was a flimsy pretext and might not get me anywhere , but it was the best I could do at such short notice .
After all , he had little to go on -- the evidence was too flimsy .
His right arm was soaked with the Frenchman 's blood that had saturated the flimsy green sleeve of his old uniform .
They are in a drawer of the flimsy wardrobe .
The flimsy yellow chair behind Wexford 's rosewood desk creaked as he lowered his heavy body into it .
June unwrapped the flimsy tissue paper from one of the almond biscuits and rolled it carefully into a tube .
